hints.content:
##Strategy

We should first identify the atoms touching each other.

The length along which the atoms touch each other can be written in terms of radii of the atoms.

##Solution

In a BCC unit cell, atoms touch each other along the body diagonal as shown below.

[[☃ image 1]]

Let's relate the length  ($\text b$)  of the diagonal to $\text r$ and $\text x$ separately in order to establish a relationship between $\text x$ and $\text r$.

Here, the length of the body diagonal ($\text b$) can be written as the sum of radii of the $2$ corner atoms and the diameter of the central atom.

$\begin{align}\implies\text b&=\text r + 2\text r+ \text r
\\\\
\implies\text b&=4\text r\end{align}$

Applying the Pythagoras theorem in $\Delta AEF$ we get,

[[☃ image 2]]

$\begin{align}\left (\text {AE}\right)^2&=\left (\text {EF}\right)^2 + \left (\text {AF}\right)^2
\\\\
\left (\text {b}\right)^2&=\left (\sqrt{2}\,\text {x}\right)^2 + \left (\text {x}\right)^2\end{align}$

[[☃ explanation 1]]

Substituting the value of $\text b$ we get,

$\begin{align}\left (4\text {r}\right)^2&=\left (\sqrt{2}\,\text {x}\right)^2 + \left (\text {x}\right)^2\end{align}$

options.explanation:
Applying the Pythagoras theorem in $\Delta DEF$ we get,

$\begin{align}\left (\text {EF}\right)^2&=\left (\text {ED}\right)^2 + \left (\text {DF}\right)^2
\\\\
\left (\text {EF}\right)^2&=\left (\text {x}\right)^2 + \left (\text {x}\right)^2
\\\\
\left (\text {EF}\right)^2&=2\left (\text {x}\right)^2 
\\\\
\text{EF}&=\sqrt{2} \,\text x\end{align}$

hints.content:
The equation that relates $\text x$ and $\text r$ is

$\left(\sqrt{2}\,\text x\right)^2+ \left(\text x\right)^2$= ${\left(4\text r\right)^2}$.

question.content:
Sodium ($\text {Na}$) crystallises to form a BCC unit cell having edge length $\text x$.

**If $\text r$ is the radius of a $\text {Na}$ atom, identify the equation that relates $\text x$ and $\text r$.**
